clinical_study.brief_title: Rifaximin in Patients With Gastroesophageal Variceal Bleeding
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Rafiximin in Patients With Cirrhotic Gastroesophageal Variceal Hemorrhage: A Single-center Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Rifaximin in the treatment of cirrhotic gastroesophageal variceal bleeding.

detailed_description.textblock:
Gastroesophageal variceal bleeding is the most common and life-threatening condition in patients with portal hypertension, which are susceptibility to bacterial infection.
However, the prophylaxis use of antibiotics remained uncertain and lack of high level evidences.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of all clinical adverse events
primary_outcome.description: The occurrence of rebleeding, ascites fluid infection, hepatorenal syndrome, hepatopulmonary syndrome, portal vein thrombosis, or death in 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of all clinical adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of rebleeding, ascites fluid infection, hepatorenal syndrome, hepatopulmonary syndrome, portal vein thrombosis, or death in 6 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: The changes of plasma endotoxins level

arm_group.description: Receive routine endoscopic treatment without having rifaximin for 2 months

intervention.description: Patients receive Rifaximin 400mg bid for 2 months
